ANALYSIS


The first step in analysing EDA data is to preprocess it to remove artifacts and noise, and then parameterise raw EDA values into EDA parameters. The two most common methods of parameterisation are peak detection and model-based approaches. Peak detection is a simple analysis method, used mainly for manual EDA parameterisation; but it lacks reliability in the case of superimposed SCRs [15]. Model-based approaches are automated methods that solve the superimposed SCR problem.
